did.abstract: Professional and family correspondence especially during the 1860s, chiefly relating to naval and military matters during and after the Civil War, but also referring to depredations and hardships suffered by those at home, freedmen in Georgetown, S.C., and to daughter Eva Dahlgren's travels in Europe, especially Italy. Also includes a ground rent deed of 1848-1849 containing the name of Joel Barlow Sutherland a former U.S. Representative from Pennsylvania.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: John Adolphus Bernard Dahlgren was a Naval admiral and ordnance inventor, and resident of Philadelphia, Pa.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Professional and family correspondence especially during the 1860s, chiefly relating to naval and military matters during and after the Civil War, but also referring to depredations and hardships suffered by those at home, freedmen in Georgetown, S.C., and to daughter Eva Dahlgren's travels in Europe, especially Italy. Also includes a ground rent deed of 1848-1849 containing the name of Joel Barlow Sutherland a former U.S. Representative from Pennsylvania.
